intro: Crataegus reverchonii var. stevensiana, commonly known as the Stevenses hawthorn, is a shrub or small tree native to the southeastern United States. It typically grows to a height of 3–10 meters and is characterized by its thorny branches and clusters of white to pink flowers in the spring. The plant produces small, red berries that are edible but often have a tart flavor. It thrives in a variety of soil types but prefers well-drained soils and full sun. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and horticultural use.
